fields.description:
h3. Summary
The File.deleteOnExit API is flawed and causes JVM crashes on long running servers. See http://bugs.java.com/view_bug.do?bug_id=4513817 :

{quote}Every time I use "ImageIO.write(img, "png", outStream)" a temporary file is
created, and the "deleteOnExit()" function is called on that temporary file.
Every "deleteOnExit()" allocates a "struct dlEntry" in the shared "io_util.c"
native source file. This "struct dlEntry" is about 1K in size, and will never be
freed until the system exits, so every time I do an ImageIO.write() I take up
another 1K of memory!{quote}

h3. Notes
* This will only affect long running servers

h3. Workaround
* Restart server Confluence is running on occasionally
fields.summary: File.deleteOnExit() Java API call causes JVM crashes on long running servers

fields.description:
Using characters like '*' in the title does break the page with a Server Error. While this is a known issue I think it is a bug and it should be fixed. The workaround with changing the value by hand afterwards in SQL is not always easy possible.

An elegant solution would be either forbid illegal characters in the title at all or use some encoding.

Note: I did not find any other bug report, maybe I used wrong search terms. Also I did not come across a statement that this is fixed in a newer version.
fields.summary: Forbid illegal characters in title

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38762].
  {panel}

When Searching for documents in the Confluence free-text search box, a lot of documents are hard to find, when not KNOWING exactly what to search for.

In our case, we have a lot of settings. Their names are separated by a . (DOT), and it is extremely hard finding documents where these settings are mentioned, or where part of the words of the setting name are mentioned.

See below:

h1. These cases matches my test-page
!Matches.png|thumbnail!

h1. These does NOT find my page. I would like them all to find it!
!NotMatching.png|thumbnail!

I'd say, that searching for just *PTCSC* in this case should find my document.

Furthermore, searching for the end of a word does not seem to work either, in our case, "*.PTCSC.Suffix" does not find the document.

!EndsWithNotMatching.png|thumbnail!

h1. This is actually one of the reasons people at our organisation feels that Confluence might not be the best tool for documentation; it is hard to find documents with relevant content.

Yes. There are tags. We use those, but finding content is key.
fields.summary: Finding documents with words separated by DOT

fields.description:
This problem was reported by one of our users. While most people are unlikely to view a page with CSS disabled, it seems wrong that a commercial product behaves in this way. It looks very unprofessional and appears to indicate that our company is using a piece of software without permission from the owner.

*To reproduce*
# Open Firefox and display a Confluence page that contains the code macro.
# In Firefox, disable CSS using the *View* > *Page Style* > *No Style* menu option.
# Scroll down the page to the code macro. There is a small +{color:blue}?{color}+ link at the top right of the code - this looks as if it will simply redisplay the page (hover over link displayed is {{https://....../wiki/pages/viewpage.action?spaceKey=KEY&title=PAGETITLE#}}). 
# Click on this link, a pop-up window is displayed with Alex Gorbatchev's copyright statement and a request for donations to support the development of the plug-in.

This is unlikely to be a browser-specific problem.

As stated earlier, this is really _not_ what we'd expect from an enterprise solution. While most users probably won't turn off the CSS intentionally, it's fairly common for slow internet access or poor response times from a website to result in a page being displayed without CSS.
fields.summary: Code macro displays message requesting donations if CSS is disabled for a page

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
This ticket is about IE11 and Microsoft IME. If you're experiencing an issue with Chrome, please see https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-55177.

The issues have similar symptoms but have different causes and affect different browsers and IMEs.
{panel}
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38758].
{panel}
h3. Summary

Users cannot type double byte characters (i.e. Japanese, Korean, Chinese) in Sections in Confluence pages when using the Microsoft IME through IE11 (see below).
h3. Environment
 * IE11 (the problem did not occur in Firefox and Chrome)
 * Microsoft IME (the problem did not occur in [Google Japanese IME|https://www.google.co.jp/ime/])

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install a vanilla Confluence 5.8.8
 # Log in using Microsoft Internet Explorer 11 with Microsoft IME enabled
 # Create a space and click the "Create" button to create a page
 # In page edit mode, create a section in body field using the page editor controls
 # Try to type double byte characters (i.e. Japanese, Korean, Chinese)

h3. Expected Results

Users can type double byte characters. Specifically 'あ' will be shown when typing 'a' when using Japanese IME.
h3. Actual Results

Users cannot type double byte characters. Specifically 'a' will be shown when typing 'a' even when using Japanese IME.
 No exceptions are thrown in the atlassian-confluence.log file, or the browser error console.
  
h3. Notes
 - Users cannot type double characters but they can copy/paste the characters

h3. Workarounds
 - Use different a browser aside from IE11
 - Use another IME aside from Microsoft's IME (i.e. [Google Japanese IME|https://www.google.co.jp/ime/%20for%20Japanese])
 - Instead of creating pages using page sections, use Section Macros. These are available on the macro browser.
 - Create content outside of Confluence, then copy/paste into Confluence page sections

 

!theProblem.jpg|width=488,height=366!
fields.summary: Cannot type double byte characters in page sections when using Microsoft IME through IE11

fields.description:
Inserting a large year value in the date field of the blog post causes unexpected behaviour and/or lost pages.

To replicate this bug, I created a blog post and changed the year to:
190728635190728635190728635190728635190728635-08-11 (A bit ridiculous, but fun :D)

And then I added some random crap into the required fields and clicked submit.


What happened was one of two things:
1) everything gets created fine, but the year gets changed to something more palatable for Confluence to understand (e.g. 190728635 > January)
2) Everything appears to be created fine, but the blog page itself doesn't get created and you get a "page not found" error
(please see attached images)
fields.summary: Create blog posts in the future

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using the {{http://confluenceurl/users/userpicker.action}} window in a fresh installation, checking the users I want to add to a group the _Select User(s)_ button does nothing.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install a Confluence 5.8.8
# Add a new user
# Go under _Groups_ in the User Management
# Select a group to add the new user
# Click on _Add Members_
# Click on the _magnifying_ icon 
# Check the new user
# Click on the _Select User(s)_ button

h3. Expected Results
* The select users would be added to the group

h3. Actual Results
* Nothing happens

h3. Notes
* To diagnose it, after Step 7, in Google Chrome web browser > Tools > Developer Tool > click on the _Select User(s)_ button > select Console tab
 !Error1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Possible Cause

The Javascript that takes the users you selected from the user picker and automatically adds it to the form is either not firing, or throwing an error when firing. 

h3.Workaround
# Use the user picker to identify the username(s) you want to add
# Type the username(s) in the form field that requires a username, such as the field for adding users to a group or adding restrictions to a user.
fields.summary: Unable to Select Users in the userpicker.action page

The following Powerpoint file can not be renderer ( There was a problem converting this attachment. Please create an issue at http://jira.atlassian.com ).

Only message in the log:

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce the issue. 
# Create a new space called "TEST".
# Create a new page with title "bla: test" 
# Create a child page for the new page. 
# Create a new page with pagetree macro and set the root page to "bla: test"

h3. Expected behaviour 
The pagetree should display correctly with one page. 

h3. Actual behaviour
It shows the error message:
{noformat}
The root page TEST:bla: test could not be found in space TEST. 
{noformat}

h3. Root cause: 
# version 5.5 or earlier: the space after column is stripped by Pagetree macro when saving the page, as consequence the search is running against to a wrong title as it become "bla:test".
# version 5.6 and later: the auto complete add the space key in the page title, which makes the page title become "TEST:bla: test".

h3. Workaround solution: 
Upgrade Confluence to the latest release 5.6.x, then remove the space key added before save the pagetree macro.
fields.summary: Pagetree macro failed to find the parent page title contain ": " (column with a space)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38746].
  {panel}

h3. Improvement
Lock the top bar (also incorrectly - in Confluence parlance - referred to by users as menu bar or navigation bar or header) for continuous access to menus, navigation buttons, search field, etc.
h3. Current Status
The top bar is not fixed and thus menus, navigation buttons, etc. are no longer immediately accessible when vertically scrolling to read content. 
h3. Use Case
If I am reading a comment and want to view another page (either simultaneously in another window or separately in another tab) +without losing my current place+, I need direct and constant access to the top bar. Otherwise, by scrolling up or using shortcuts to access the top navigation bar, my current location in the page is lost and I must scroll down again to the previous location.
*Typical example:*
While reading the comments on a page, you find one that you are sure was discussed in a meeting, the notes of which are in another Space. The _Home_ or _Pos1_ key will generally take you back to the top of a page, while the shortcut _GG_ puts the focus in the search field. Unfortunately, all of these cause you to lose your position on the current page. As such, you can not use the top bar components (buttons, search field, etc) to open another browser tab/window without losing the current page position. This is particularly inconvenient for quickly viewing two or more Confluence pages simultaneously.
h3. Related Cases
[CONF-38219] addresses the same issue, but was ambiguously described and taken to be a suggestion for creating a special page template.
[JRA-27758]
JRA-21963
fields.summary: Lock top bar (menu / navigation)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38738].
  {panel}

Confluence/JIRA administrators get frustrated, when they need to do the same thing differently in Confluence than in JIRA:
To add an announcement banner in confluence you can do the following things:
* Change the site layout - https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+add+a+site-wide+banner
* Install a plugin - e.g. [Announcement Banner for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1217921/announcement-banner-for-confluence] OR [Announcer for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1211907/announcer-for-confluence]

In JIRA you simply set the corresponding administration option: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+an+Announcement+Banner

It would be best if Confluence provides the same administration option as JIRA (and gets as well the same updates/improvements for that feature).

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - September 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
With the introduction of Read-only mode in version 6.10 ([release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-6-10-release-notes-952058221.html]), Data Center customers can now also show a custom banner message (with and without read-only mode). Please note that this functionality is not natively available for Server instances. At this time you may use one of the workarounds above.

Cheers,

Adam Barnes - Confluence PM
{panel}
fields.summary: Add an administration option for announcement banners in Confluence like in JIRA

fields.description:
h5. Summary
There is a known compatibility issue that prevents the user management synchronisation between JIRA 6.4 and Confluence 5.7.x and above. 

This will only affect you if you use JIRA to manage your Confluence users. The bug in JIRA is being tracked on [JRA-42566|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-42566].

\\
h5. Environment
-  Confluence version: 5.7.x, 5.8.x
- JIRA version: 6.4

\\
h5. Steps to Reproduce
- Case 1
-# Set up Confluence 5.7.x and above with JIRA 6.4 configured as its User Management Server. To perform that, please refer to [Connecting Confluence to JIRA for user management|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Connecting+to+Crowd+or+JIRA+for+User+Management#ConnectingtoCrowdorJIRAforUserManagement-ConnectingConfluencetoJIRAforUserManagement].
-# Perform Synchronisation.
- Case 2
-# Install Confluence 5.7.x and above as per the [Confluence Setup Guide|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Setup+Guide] documentation.
(i) Instead of managing users and groups within Confluence itself, choose _Connect to JIRA_ and setup [JIRA External User Management|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Setup+Guide#ConfluenceSetupGuide-8.SetupusermanagementUserMan] (JIRA 6.4 instance) instead.

\\
h5. Expected Results
Synchronisation should work successfully as per expected.

\\
h5. Actual Results
Synchronisation fails and the below exception is thrown in the atlassian-confluence.log file:
{noformat}
2015-07-22 13:49:12,755 INFO [Long running task: Synchronising JIRA Directory] [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory] synchroniseCache failed 
synchronisation complete for directory [ 131073 ] in [ 946ms ]
2015-07-22 13:49:12,768 ERROR [Long running task: Synchronising JIRA Directory] [confluence.setup.actions.ConnectToJiraSyncDirectoryAction$SyncJiraDirectory
LongRunningTask] runInternal Synchronization failed.
 -- referer: http://localhost:8090/setup/connecttojira-start.action | url: /setup/connecttojirasyncdirectory-start.action | userName: anonymous | action: co
nnecttojirasyncdirectory-start
com.atlassian.crowd.exception.runtime.OperationFailedException: Error from Crowd server propagated to here via REST API (check the Crowd server logs for det
ails): Class type for return values ('interface com.atlassian.crowd.model.group.GroupWithAttributes') is not 'String' or 'Group'
        at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.CrowdDirectoryServiceImpl.synchroniseDirectory(CrowdDirectoryServiceImpl.java:208)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.setup.actions.ConnectToJiraSyncDirectoryAction$SyncJiraDirectoryLongRunningTask.runInternal(ConnectToJiraSyncDirectoryAc
tion.java:213)
...
Caused by: com.atlassian.crowd.integration.rest.service.CrowdRestException: Class type for return values ('interface com.atlassian.crowd.model.group.GroupWithAttributes') is not 'String' or 'Group'
        at com.atlassian.crowd.integration.rest.service.RestExecutor$MethodExecutor.throwError(RestExecutor.java:656)
        at com.atlassian.crowd.integration.rest.service.RestExecutor$MethodExecutor.andReceive(RestExecutor.java:485)
        at com.atlassian.crowd.integration.rest.service.RestCrowdClient.searchGroupsWithAttributes(RestCrowdClient.java:572)
{noformat}

\\
h5. Workaround
This is a bug in JIRA 6.4 and is fixed in JIRA 6.4.1. The preferred solution is to upgrade to JIRA 6.4.1.
fields.summary: JIRA 6.4 as a Crowd Server does not work with Confluence version 5.7.x and above

Without autoplay selected

batch.js?jquery.external=true&atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-GB&build-number=6138:259 unable to auto size flash - took too long to load

Playing the file in Chrome, Firefox, or Safari in another tab renders the flash file correctly so its not the file that is corrupt

There is currently no workaround

h3. Problem Definition
It is not possible to restrict a user to edit a page without granting him the space permission "add pages", that makes the user able to create pages in all the space.

It should be possible to restrict a user do edit a page even without the permission to add pages in all the space.

fields.description:
Client has a problem running Confluence 5.7.x with MySQL as the database backend, but has found that a primary page visited by CIO/CTO takes approximately 18 seconds to load as the MySQL database can not handle the functional indexes for lowercase queries. 

This is related to [CONFDEV-35393|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFDEV-35393] and is a problem with performance. Our client has performed the workaround in [Creating a lowercase page title  index|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF57/Creating+a+Lowercase+Page+Title+Index] and these steps had to be altered slightly (will add as aa comment hereto) to make the changes work. 

However, mixed-case pages are not able to be found using the search (as we have documented in the article). Our client has found that altering the database collation provides better performance overall with the instance than the UTF-8 collation.

They would like to know if there are any risks to altering the database collation as they are not seeing issues with the foreign character display or other functions in the instance, and would like to  know for certain if there are any additional risks to changing their collation to be case-insensitive, in other words, will any additional functionality be lost by changing the DB (MySQL) collation to be case insensitive (ci)?
fields.summary: Database Collation Change to CI versus UTF-8

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38720].
  {panel}

Ideally there would be some mildly intrusive, perhaps translucent, line running from a comment box to the paragraph it's linked to.   Perhaps the lines would be visible only when the comment box gets moused over.
As comments are mapped at the paragraph level, and as a single paragraph may have multiple comments, this scheme may get tangled quickly

An alternative would be:
* _Based on the fact that the (very) pale blue megaphone icon indicates a paragraph has a comment associated with it._
* each comment box has some unique identifier at its top, say, a serial (index) number.   The # would be displayed about as visibly as the commenter's name.
* either overlay the (very) pale blue megaphone with the comment identifier, or, display the comment identifier associated with the  (v)PBM _when it gets moused-over.)

Here's my use case:
* I'm commenting on a document.
* A lot.
* I made a long comment at para. 5.
* Then I made comments at paras 6, 8, & 9.   Strangely, the para 5 comment continues to float below (further down the page) as I create these new comments, getting further & further away from its home paragraph.
* I edited the para 5 comment to note that it relates to para 5.
* After the change to the para 5 comment, *_it_* now aligns with para 5.   The para 6, 8, & 9 comments, however, remain _above_ the para 5 comment, so now _they_ are super displaced from their relevant texts.
I'm hoping this comment disordering issue has already been addressed.
The issue of easily associating comments with their paragraphs remains, and is particularly painful when many comments are present.

I'm working in Firefox, and I've saved the page in .maff, mhtml and "as complete webpage" formats.   I will attach 1 or all to this ticket, in case it might benefit you.  That's why I'm indicating "Security Level" != "None"
fields.summary: Need some better (more obvious) way to map comments to the para they discuss
Can't attach files to a Draft via REST API

fields.description:
Dear Confluence-Team,

I would like to report the following bug (reproducable):

1. Create a new Status Macro
!Scn_1.png|thumbnail!

2. Select Status and add a Link (CTRL + K)

3. Select "Search" and add a Page as Link
!Scn_2.png|thumbnail!

4. Save page

{color:#d04437}5. Status Makro disapears{color}
fields.summary: Status-Macro disapears after creating a Link to a Confluence Page

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*
# Open Any browser
# Add an attachment to a Confluence page, save.
# Click on the --- drop down and select Attachments (1)
# Resize the sidebar on the left, rightwards (or visit a page which has had the sidebar previously resized) or resize the browser window
# Name column will truncate the document title and eventually hide the Name all together.

*Expected Results*
The table of attachments, should resize accordingly when adjusting the sidebar on the left. Name, Size, Creator, Creation Date etc should all adjust accordingly.

*Actual Results*
The Name column is the only column that will resize in relation to width. The other columns remain fixed width.
This also affects devices with a smaller screen resolution.

*Affected browsers*
Issue should affect *all browsers*, and have been confirmed on the following.
# IE
# Chrome
# Firefox
fields.summary: Resizing the sidebar cause's the Name column to disappear (Attachments)

fields.description:
h5.Steps to reproduce
# Create a Word document with an image under a first level heading
# Copy the image to a second level heading (so the image appears once under head level of heading)
# Import the document into Confluence, and split the import by Level 2 headings

h5.Expected Results
The page for the second level heading should show the image as it appears in the Word document

h5.Actual Results
The page shows "Unknown attachment"

h5.Investigation
The image from the word document is correctly attached to the parent page, but image references in the child page will refer to the page's attachments - which are not there.

h5.Workaround:
# Option One: Attach the images to the child pages as well.
# Option Two: Delete the image on the child page, and search for the image using the "Search on Other Pages" feature. You can also copy and paste the image from the parent page while in edit mode - this will reference the attachment on the child page
fields.summary: When importing a Word document split by level headings, attachments are not referenced to the parent page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38708].
  {panel}

The Atlassian SDK atlas-create* commands do not trim spaces from class names. This results in a skeleton plugin with broken imports and packages. The error message in the IDE recommends to fix this issue by refactoring the class "from  a.b.c to a.b.c", which looks redundant to a human reader. At second look, I see it was generated with illegal whitespace in the code, and in directory names.

I likely introduced the spaces into the wizard by copying and pasting the groupId and artifactId etc from another terminal window (e.g. selected an extra space before the groupId by accident). I assume the same problem can also happen at all other steps, e.g. where we rename MyServlet.java. 

No class or package can start with space anyway. Atlas-create* should just trim it, and not generate a needlessly broken skeleton. 

Examples of inconsistencies:

* MyPluginComponent.java and MyPluginComponentImpl.java start with "package  too.many.spaces;" 
* pom.xml says: "<groupId>too.many.spaces</groupId>"
* atlassian-plugin.xml says: <component key="myPluginComponent" class=" too.many.spaces.MyPluginComponentImpl" public="true"><interface>too.many.spaces.MyPluginComponent</interface></component>
* atlassian-plugin.xml says: <servlet name="My Servlet" i18n-name-key="my-servlet.name" key="my-servlet" class="too.many.spaces.servlet.MyServlet">
* Also the test files have spaces in package and import.
* Extra whitespace in directory names such as " just-testing".

Reproduce:

{{C:\Users\someone\TEST>atlas-create-confluence-plugin
[...]
Define value for groupId: :  too.many.spaces
Define value for artifactId: :  just-testing
Define value for version:  1.0-SNAPSHOT: :
Define value for package:   too.many.spaces: :
Confirm properties configuration:
groupId:  too.many.spaces
artifactId:  just-testing
version: 1.0-SNAPSHOT
package:  too.many.spaces
 Y: : Y
[...]
[INFO] BUILD SUCCESS
C:\Users\someone\TEST>cd " just-testing"
C:\Users\someone\TEST\ just-testing>atlas-create-confluence-plugin-module
[...]
[INFO] --- maven-confluence-plugin:5.0.13:create-plugin-module (default-cli) @ just-testing ---
Choose Plugin Module: 
[...]
[INFO] Adding the following items to the project:
[INFO]   [class: it.too.many.spaces.servlet.MyServletFuncTest]
[INFO]   [class: too.many.spaces.servlet.MyServlet]
[INFO]   [class: ut.too.many.spaces.servlet.MyServletTest]
[...]
[INFO] BUILD SUCCESS
C:\Users\someone\TEST\ just-testing>
}}
fields.summary: Atlassian SDK keeps illegal whitespace in package names

fields.description:
h3. When using the Live search macro and searching based on label, the search results do not narrow to include only pages with specific labels

h3. Environment
Confluence Server / Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add Live search macro to page
# Configure live search macro to use specific label
# Search for pages with specific labels added

h3. Expected Results
Live search macro should return results that include pages that have the specific label attached to them

h3. Actual Results
Live search macro returns pages that do not have the specific label added to them
 
h3.Workaround
No current work around
fields.summary: Live search macro does not narrow search results

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#FFFF99}
 (!) *NOTE:* Should you're still seeing this issue in your Confluence instance (version 5.9.1 and above), please refer to the bug - [CONFSERVER\-58261: Missing unique constraints and index in fresh Confluence installation|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-58261] for further details.
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When installing Confluence from scratch, additional constraints are not being added.

h3. Environment

* PostgreSQL is being used as the database

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Configure PostgreSQL as per [Database Setup for PostgreSQL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Database+Setup+for+PostgreSQL]
# Install Confluence as per [Confluence Installation Guide|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Installation+Guide]

h3. Expected Results

The following constraints/indexes should exist on the tables:

cwd_group:
* cwd_group_name_dir_id

cwd_user:
* cwd_user_name_dir_id

cwd_membership:
* cwd_unique_user_membership
* cwd_unique_group_membership

cwd_group_attribute:
* cwd_unique_grp_attr unique

cwd_user_attribute:
* cwd_unique_usr_attr unique

content_perm:
* cp_unique_user
* cp_unique_group

content_perm_set:
* cps_unique_type

bandana:
* bandana_unique_key

os_propertyentry:
* ospe_entityid_idx

h3. Actual Results

The above mentioned constraints are not present in the database.
 

h3.Workaround

WARNING: Make sure to back up the database before applying any SQL commands that modify the database, and ensure Confluence is not running while applying the change

For PostgreSQL, you can run the below SQL statements to add the missing constraints and indexes, assuming that the constraints haven't been broken in the mean time:

{code:sql}
-- Embedded Crowd constraints
alter table cwd_group add constraint cwd_group_name_dir_id unique (lower_group_name, directory_id);
alter table cwd_user add constraint cwd_user_name_dir_id unique (lower_user_name, directory_id);
alter table cwd_membership add constraint cwd_unique_user_membership unique (parent_id, child_user_id);
alter table cwd_membership add constraint cwd_unique_group_membership unique (parent_id, child_group_id);
alter table cwd_group_attribute add constraint cwd_unique_grp_attr unique (directory_id, group_id, attribute_name, attribute_lower_value);
alter table cwd_user_attribute add constraint cwd_unique_usr_attr unique (directory_id, user_id, attribute_name, attribute_lower_value);

-- Content Permission constraints
alter table CONTENT_PERM add constraint cp_unique_user unique (CPS_ID, CP_TYPE, USERNAME);
alter table CONTENT_PERM add constraint cp_unique_group unique (CPS_ID, CP_TYPE, GROUPNAME);
alter table CONTENT_PERM_SET add constraint cps_unique_type unique (CONTENT_ID, CONT_PERM_TYPE);

-- Bandana constraints
alter table BANDANA add constraint bandana_unique_key unique (BANDANACONTEXT, BANDANAKEY);

-- Property Entry index
create index ospe_entityid_idx on OS_PROPERTYENTRY (entity_id);
{code}

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38701].
  {panel}

I have copied some of the comments from CONF-29116, since this issue is resolved and there are no response on comments regarding children and current page.

CQL doesn't currently offer a resolution to this use case since it allows you to specify a specific ancestor or parent rather than the current page as the ancestor or parent. This means that you have to specify a specific page name, so it can't be used when creating templates. What's needed is the equivalent of the Space function currentSpace() to allow users to specify that the page on which the macro appears is the intended ancestor/parent, e.g. ancestor = currentPage().

It should be possible to use this in a template by (i.e.) adding @self as the ancestor value.

Page Properties Report should replace Matadata Report, since this macro is no longer supported. Metadata Report plugin which had this functionality and led to very useful templates. Everything that was possible with Metadata Plugin ver. 1 should be possible in Page Properties Report.

fields.description:
To reproduce:

* start Confluence with GC logging enabled (optional, but helps)
* Link Confluence and JIRA
* create an issue in JIRA
* watch it
* add a large comment to the JIRA issue, e.g. paste a 7.7MB log file between \{code\} tags
* open the workbox in Confluence (optional: in network tab of web developer tools)
* check
** CPU usage of Confluence: it switches between one http thread using 100% CPU to render the comment and as many threads as the GC uses to collect the garbage that the thread produces
** GC log of Confluence: you will see frequent full garbage collections, all freeing big parts of the heap (in our case for example: Full GC every 5 seconds, heap 5G -> 1G, taking 2-5 seconds)
** if Confluence is not dead yet, check the network tab in the browser: {{/rest/mywork/latest/notification/nested?limit=30}} loads a huge file (examples in our case: 21MB, 43MB before gzip), as it loads the whole comment in html
** take a heap dump of Confluence just before a garbage collection. When analyzing in Eclipse Memory Analyzer, use [-keep_unreachable_objects|https://wiki.eclipse.org/MemoryAnalyzer/FAQ#How_to_analyse_unreachable_objects]
*** you will find big char arrays/Strings containing the various parts of the comment, embedded in {{org.apache.xerces.dom.TextImpl}}, which suggests that the whole comment is parsed as html/xml and kept in memory at once
* check the table {{AO_9412A1_AONOTIFICATION}} in the Confluence database. It contains several entries with a large {{DESCRIPTION}} field, even though only one large comment was added. It seems that one comment triggers new entries in this table again and again, which is also reflected in the workbox that says "9 comments on <ISSUEKEY>", although there is only one comment.


On a production system with a reasonable load, enough request queue up during the GC pauses to render the system unusable - garbage is produced faster than it can be collected.

Note: this has security implications as well, as any user that can comment on issues can DOS the system easily - they do not even require another user to watch the ticket, as they are notified of their own JIRA actions in Confluence, see CONF-30081.

Suggestions for mitigation:
* JIRA should not allow comments that big
* JIRA should not send the whole comment to Confluence
* Confluence should stop processing the comment after a few lines, and show a "read more" link instead of the whole comment (like the JIRA activity stream does)
fields.summary: Workbox Plugin loads full HTML of JIRA comment, leads to GC loop of death on large comment
Option to hide comments from anonymous

fields.description:
In the page: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Recognised+System+Properties we've got:
{noformat}
index.queue.thread.count

3.3

See "Effect"

Confluence

Sets the number of threads to be used for the reindex job. The value has to be in the range of 1 to 10 (inclusive), i.e. at least one thread but no more than 10 threads will be used. There is no default value, i.e.

If you don't set index.queue.thread.count, the number of threads to be used are calculated based on the number of objects that need to be reindexed and the number of processors available (a maximum of 10 threads will be used).
If you set index.queue.thread.count=2, then two threads will be used to reindex the content (regardless of the number of objects to be reindexed or the number of processors available)
If you set index.queue.thread.count=200, then ten threads (the maximum allowed) will be used to reindex the content.
{noformat}
The current maximum is 50 instead of 10 in the newer version.
fields.summary: The information of variable "index.queue.thread.count" in the page "Recognised System Properties" is out of date

fields.description:
When the search results page is displayed, if a space restriction is in place, the Space filter should always show the current restriction. This is not true in the following circumstances:

* You use the Live search macro to search
* You use the pagetree search macro to search
* The documentation theme is set to limit results to the current space and you use the search field in the top of right of the page to search.

The information is present on the page because when you open the Space filter drop-down you can see the correct space highlighted. However the information is hidden from the user because the Space filter is blank.

While this may seem like a trivial point, our users are continually complaining that they cannot find information. Often they are searching the wrong space and unaware that they are only looking in one space.
fields.summary: Space filter is not populated when the search results are displayed

fields.description:
Sometimes, *we experience an issue with finding images via search*. To be more precise, here are the steps one of our users has done:
# Upload png image to page A
# Opened page B and tried to insert png image of page A, but was not able to find it

If we as admins now try to upload the same image again, we are still not able to find it (index is not indexed properly). 

If we as admins remove the png image on page A and upload it again, we have the same issue.

On our log, we just got this event:
{code}
2015-08-04 10:06:18,043 WARN [http-bio-8080-exec-596] [confluence.util.profiling.DurationThresholdWarningTimingHelperFactory] logMessage Execution time for publishing event com.atlassian.confluence.event.events.content.attachment.AttachmentBatchUploadCompletedEvent[source=com.atlassian.confluence.pages.DefaultAttachmentManager@7a453272] took 9638 ms (warning threshold is 5000 ms)
 -- url: /confluence/plugins/drag-and-drop/upload.action | userName: ***8fe | referer: https://*/confluence/pages/viewpageattachments.action?pageId=329628126&sortBy=name | action: upload
{code}


*What solved the issue:*
Rename the png file on page A to a different name, then rename it to the original name.
fields.summary: Attachments are not indexed properly when uploading

fields.description:
h5.Scenario
While a scheduled task is running, Confluence experiences a momentary timeout when connecting to the database. Because of the brief window of disconnection, Confluence itself is unaffected. However, the scheduled task is not able to complete, and prevents other jobs from starting.

The exact cause may vary, but the underlying problem is that if for some reason the task becomes stuck, the scheduled jobs screen will be oblivious of this stuck state.

h5.Symptoms
Even though the scheduled tasks will continue to be submitted, they will never actually run. The scheduled tasks screen in Confluence Admin will continue to update when the job _should_ have ran, if things were working correctly.

h5.What should we fix?
In addition to when a job was submitted, a job should record when it actually finished. This would allow a system administrator to identify a potentially stuck job.

Highlighting consistent failures to complete would also be useful.
fields.summary: The "Scheduled Tasks" screen does not accurately reflect the state of scheduled tasks if one becomes stuck

fields.description:
Inline images aren't being recognised properly on some email clients. Specifically, if the resource comes from a plugin (and thus the Content Name of the image contains a ":" character) rendering will fail. This is probably because of some picky clients following http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6838#section-4.2 very closely, which says that ":" is actually not a valid character in the content name.

Reproduction steps:

# Install [Thunderbird|https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/thunderbird/] and add your email account for Confluence
# Assign a task to yourself on a page (ensure the "notify on my own changes" setting is enabled under User Settings)
# Look at the email in Thunderbird - it should appear as the attached screenshot, with 2 attachments and the images not rendered inline.
fields.summary: Some inline images render incorrectly on some email clients

Using the name of the field (instead of alias) works as expected (e.g. project = TST order by issuetype).

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38684].
  {panel}

h3. Problem 

We run into this problem quite often. When we print we want to print the page precisely as it currently looks. (i.e With Expand macros all collapsed, or some collapsed and some expanded).

At the moment the page just prints as though all the Expands are expanded.  Not useful!

As a work around we have to Duplicate the page, remove the expands, save and print.  It means we always have to maintain a 2ndary copy of some articles with empty Expand macros.

Exporting to PDF is not a viable option either because the PDF rendering isn't WYSIWYG either; the images for example are all printed at 100% size, not at the size we've specified in the page.
fields.summary: Feature Request: Option to NOT expand {expand} macros when printing page.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When editing the permissions page which has a group containing "/", the page freezes upon saving the changes.

h3. Environment
* Chrome versions 36-43

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a group containing the "/", example: developers/users
# Browse to {{Confluence URL}}/spaces/spacepermissions.action?key='SPACEKEY'
# Edit any permission on the page.
# Click "Save All"
# Page freezes.

h3. Expected Results
# The page saves changes.

h3. Actual Results
# In Chrome, the page freezes.

h3.Workaround
Not ideal, but you can suspend the javascript in the page and it will save.
fields.summary: Permissions page freezes after editing when a group listed on the page contains a '/" - Chrome only

fields.description:
Creating a user macro with a string parameter which ends with a backslash, results in a page that cannot be saved.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a user macro:

{code}
## Macro title: testbackslash
## Macro has a body: N

## @param FilePath:title=Filepath|type=string|required=true
$paramFilePath
{code}

2. Create a new black page

3. Insert the user macro and set the parameter to e.g. C:\

4. Save the marco

Result:
Depending on the browser & environment, you either get a blank page that cannot be saved or a turning wheel at the macro position (page still cannot be saved).

Log shows the following error:

{code:java}
2015-08-03 09:16:30,120 ERROR [ajp-nio-192.168.2.188-8009-exec-9] [schb.local].[/confluence].[servlet-module-container-servlet]] log Servlet.service() for servlet [servlet-module-container-servlet] in context with path [/confluence] threw exception
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Name cannot be null
	at com.atlassian.confluence.xhtml.api.MacroDefinition.<init>(MacroDefinition.java:73)
{code}
fields.summary: User macro with trailing backslash in parameter cannot be saved throws log error
Fully functioning PDFs
Print function on the attachment preview screen.

None of the bars overlap.

fields.description:
Embedded images can track a css style attribute as described in the Storage Format definition here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Storage+Format#ConfluenceStorageFormat-Images

This attribute is lost when an image is being written using com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.ImageAttributeWriter#writeAttributes(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, com.atlassian.confluence.xhtml.api.EmbeddedImage)
fields.summary: Embedded Image ac:style attribute being lost

fields.description:
Currently, the /status endpoint uses {{pluginFrameworkStartedEvent}} to determine when to transition from STARTING to RUNNING.

However we should wait until all upgrade tasks and plugin upgrade tasks are done - it would be better to listen to one of the application started type events.

Right now Confluence nodes look like they are ready to serve before they are, causing issues with load balancers etc.
fields.summary: /status endpoint should not transition from "Starting" to "Running" before the application is fully ready

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38672].
  {panel}

Live on master at the moment.

Usernames with "+" in currently cause a error when clicking the link to the user's profile - it goes to a URL like this, which gives a 404:

https://nclarke.jira-dev.com/wiki/display/~nclarke%2B1

These usernames are legal from LDAP and are created by Cloud user management for email addresses like "nclarke+1@atlassian.com"

[~jxie] says this needs fixing here:
https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/CONF/repos/confluence/browse/confluence-core/confluence/src/java/com/atlassian/confluence/servlet/simpledisplay/SimpleDisplayServlet.java#53
fields.summary: Usernames with "+" result in broken profile links
Abigail Marlene Mansour

fields.summary: Page Tree - Unable to escape hash char

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38668].
  {panel}

The constraint {{cp_unique_user_groups unique}}  which will check the unique of the following combination of column  (cps_id, cp_type, username, groupname) in content_perm maximun size exceed 900 byte.

The username and groupname uses the nvchar type with the size  (255). Even if we calculate the groupname and username column alone, it would result in 1024 byte (The storage size of nvchar in bytes, is two times the actual length of data entered + 2 bytes)  of storage space which already exceeded the allowed the allowed [maximun size of index key length|https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms191241(v=sql.105).aspx],

 
h3. Possible workaround:
Decrease the size of the groupname and username to 100.
fields.summary: Confluence 'cp_unique_user_groups' has  a maximum value bigger than 900 bytes which is not recommend in MS SQL Server.

During indexing we can see the following warnings flooded on Confluence 5.8.6 on one of our customer instance during re-indexing :
{code}WARN [Indexer: 3] [apache.pdfbox.pdfparser.BaseParser] parseCOSArray Corrupt object reference{code}
Which might be related to the following bug report :
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/PDFBOX-2484

Which is fixed on version 1.8.8 and 2.0.0 of PDFBOX

fields.description:
We don't have a monospace keyboard shortcut so we've been told to use auto-convert. However, that doesn't work on text that already has formatting.

1.Create a text block and use CTRL+I to make it italic. 

2.Place cursor before and add {{ and then place cursor after for the }} and it ignores the monospace.

I know the flippant response is to do monospace while typing, but if we deploy confluence we will be importing word document. We're playing with the 5.8.6 demo and and we've seen that it will import the italics, but not the courier font so we have to go and fix all the monospace import issues after the fact. But the auto-convert defect is making this a slow and cumbersome process.
fields.summary: monospace autocomplete doesn't work if text already has formatting

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce:

When editing a page, if the mouse cursor is placed on the scroll bar *AND* right beside of the page title section, then the scrolling becomes non-functional; instead it will highlight the page title section. On the other hand, if the mouse cursor is placed below the page title section then the scrolling is functional.

 !scr1.jpg|thumbnail! 

I suspect issue is caused by the mouse is focusing the page title section instead of the scroll bar, even the though the scroll bar is shown on top of the page title section.
fields.summary: Unable to scroll a page in edit mode if the cursor is on top of the page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38652].
  {panel}

Links to restricted pages are displayed differently, depending on how they are inserted into a page. 

To a user who is restricted from a page that is linked to, the link displays different behavior depending on how it's inserted into the page. 

When the link is inserted as a web link, the user sees a clickable link that will redirect to a "No Permission" page (see [^no-permission.png]).

When the link is inserted via "Recently Viewed" or Search", the link is greyed out and "unclickable"  in that it simply links to "#" (see [^link-display.png]). For these, it would be better for the user if the link redirected to the "No Permission" page, or at the very least displayed some sort of message that the page is restricted from them. Without those, it seems as if the link is broken.

h4. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a page that is restricted to UserB
# On an unrestricted page, create two links to the restricted page, one using the "web link" and one using "search"
# Log in as UserB
# Click each of the links on the unrestricted page
fields.summary: Redirect to "No Permission" on links to restricted pages

If you include a <script> tag in an HTML macro, it works on a desktop browser. But with a mobile user-agent, it removes these tags, breaking some functionality.

This can be reproduced using Chrome's mobile emulation, or on a real device.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38644].
  {panel}

as per the summary, it would be great if all users will be able to reply to the user directly that have triggered the email notification.

current behavior : the "from" email address is the mailserver email address instead of the sender email address

desired behavior : preferably the "from" email address is the sender's email address so that other users can directly reply to the sender (the user that trigger the mail notification)
immediately from the mail client itself.
fields.summary: the receiver of the mail notification should be able to directly reply the user that trigger the email

fields.description:
My pages include links to sibling pages; pages that are on the same level in the space hierarchy. The way I create these links is:
# Click the Page Layout tool > Two Column Section with Right Side Bar.
# Create a single-cell table in the right column. This is so I can color the background to visually separate it from the rest of the page. See attached image.
# Create links to the sibling pages inside the table cell.
After I save, the page looks as intended. However, the next time I visit the page (this can be days later) the page has removed the original first link and replaced it with a link to itself.
In the attached image, the first link originally pointed to "Apache Mesos." Somehow, that link is gone and "Marathon" has taken it's place.
When I run across this issue, I can go in and manually change the link back to the original sibling and that seems to stick.
fields.summary: Pages change links to refer back to themselves

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38637].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As an administrator, I am not able to modify the default warning messages in the Confluence Viewfile Macro. 

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be beneficial to allow administrators to edit the text in these front end warnings to accommodate business process or provide more context on the warning/error for end users.
fields.summary: Allow Editing of Front End Warning Messages for the Confluence Viewfile Macro

***Summary***
Attachment "Download All" feature does not download attachments with Chinese Characters in IE. Verified on IE 11.

***Steps to Reproduce***
# Upload attachments with Chinese Characters in the name
# Download a normal attachment
# *Download All* attachments in the page
# The document(s) with the chinese character will not be downloaded
fields.summary: Attachment "Download All" does not download attachments with Chinese Characters in IE

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Some pages which are Favourite pages are not displayed in the Dashboard Favourite Pages list . These pages are displayed in the Favourite pages macro but not on the Dashboard .
This happens only for Internet Explorer 11 

h3. Environment
Internet Explorer 11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login to Confluence using IE 11
# Add a page as favourite page
# Go to the Dashboard and Click the Pages for Favourite pages .

h3. Expected Results
All the Favourite pages of the user should appear .

h3. Actual Results
The Favourite pages are not shown , some pages might appear .
!fav_dash.jpg!

The Favourite pages are correctly displayed in the Favourite pages macro

!fav_mac.jpg!

h3.Workaround
Use Firefox or Chrome
Or, in Internet Explorer
# Go to Cog Menu > Internet Options
# General Tab, Click Settings
# Select "Every time I visit the page"
# Click OK
# Click OK
fields.summary: Favourites Pages list on Dashboard does not show all pages in Internet Explorer

fields.description: wiki pages are not correctly displayed on the screen. I have also attached one image here.
fields.summary: wiki pages are not correctly displayed on screen
